title: Ticket #3953: better wording for regular expressions functions in ClassAds
description:
Our description of ClassAd functions that implement regular expression searches needs improvement. We should use wording more like what other documentation does, for example:

Perl 5.10.1 docs: "Searches a string for a pattern match, and in scalar context returns true if it succeeds, false if it fails."

Python 2.6.8 docs: "Scan through string looking for a location where the regular expression pattern produces a match, and return a corresponding MatchObject instance."

Ruby 2.0.0 docs: "When one operand is a regular expression and the other is a string then the regular expression is used as a pattern to match against the string."
